file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 38-32-02-04 - CONFIG-1 - WASTE DRAIN HOSE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL WASTE DRAIN HOSE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the waste drain hose. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) 38-32-02-000-801-A WASTE DRAIN HOSE - REMOVAL EMB-145 ACFT MODEL(S) 38-32-02-400-801-A WASTE DRAIN HOSE - INSTALLATION EMB-145 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-1 38-32-02 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 38-32-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 2. WASTE DRAIN HOSE - REMOVAL A. General WARNING: PREVENT CONTACT WITH THE LAVATORY FLUIDS DURING MAINTENANCE OR SERVICE IN THE LAVATORY AREA. • PUT ON SAFETY GOGGLES. • PUT ON SAFETY GLOVES. • PUT ON SAFETY CLOTHES. (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the waste drain hose. (2) To get access to the waste drain hose, you must remove: the toilet shroud assembly, the toilet unit, the mid section of the water-tank fill and overflow lines, the drip pan assembly, the toilet manifold assembly, the baggage-compartment floor lining, and baggage-compartment floor panel 272AF. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 25-40-01-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-40-04-000-801-A/400 TOILET SHROUD ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR LINING - RE- AMM TASK 25-51-04-000-801-A/400 MOVAL AMM TASK 38-10-07-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 38-32-01-000-801-A/400 TOILET UNIT - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272AF Baggage compartment floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Goggles Protection for the eyes 1 available Commercially Rubber Gloves Protection for the hands 1 available Commercially Safety Clothes Prevent contact with the lavatory fluids 1 available EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 38-32-02 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Lavatory 1 Helps with the task Under the baggage compartment floor I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-008-A (1) Remove the toilet shroud assembly ( AMM TASK 25-40-04-000-801-A/400). (2) Remove the toilet unit ( AMM TASK 38-32-01-000-801-A/400). (3) Remove the mid section of the water-tank fill and overflow lines (AMM TASK 38-10-07-000-801-A/400). (4) Remove the drip pan assembly (AMM TASK 25-40-01-000-801-A/400). (5) Remove the baggage-compartment floor lining ( AMM TASK 25-51-04-000-801-A/400). (6) Remove baggage-compartment floor panel 272AF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-008-A (1) Get access to the waste drain hose (2) through the baggage compartment floor and loosen the clamp (3) that attaches the hose to the waste drain valve (1). (2) Disengage the waste drain hose (2) from the waste drain valve (1). (3) Remove the toilet manifold assembly (Ref.) (AMM TASK 25-40-01-000-801-A/400) together with the waste drain hose (2) and the clamp (3). (4) Loosen the clamp (4) that attaches the waste drain hose (2) to the toilet manifold assembly (Ref.). (5) Disengage the waste drain hose (2) from the toilet manifold assembly (Ref.). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 38-32-02 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

CLAMP 1. WASTE DRAIN VALVE DET. A 145AMM380002.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 38-32-02 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 38-32-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 3. WASTE DRAIN HOSE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the waste drain hose. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 25-40-01-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-40-04-400-801-A/400 TOILET SHROUD ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR LINING - IN- AMM TASK 25-51-04-400-801-A/400 STALLATION AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - AMM TASK 38-10-07-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 38-32-01-400-801-A/400 TOILET UNIT - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272AF Baggage compartment floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Goggles Protection for the eyes 1 available Commercially Rubber Gloves Protection for the hands 1 available Commercially Safety Clothes Prevent contact with the lavatory fluids 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Lavatory EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 38-32-02 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (Continued) QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Helps with the task Under the baggage compartment floor I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-008-A (1) Put the waste drain hose (2) together with the clamp (4) in the installation position in the toilet manifold assembly (Ref.). (2) Tighten the clamp (4) that attaches the waste drain hose (2) to the toilet manifold assembly (Ref.). (3) Install the toilet manifold assembly (Ref.) together with the waste drain hose (2). (4) Get access through the baggage compartment floor and put the other end of the waste drain hose (2) together with the clamp (3) in the installation position in the waste drain valve (1). (5) Tighten the clamp (3) that attaches the waste drain hose (2) to the waste drain valve (1). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-008-A (1) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations of the Aircraft Maintenance Program. (2) Install baggage-compartment floor panel 272AF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (3) Install the baggage-compartment floor lining ( AMM TASK 25-51-04-400-801-A/400). (4) Install the drip pan assembly (AMM TASK 25-40-01-400-801-A/400). (5) Install the mid section of the water-tank fill and overflow lines (AMM TASK 38-10-07-400-801-A/400). (6) Install the toilet unit ( AMM TASK 38-32-01-400-801-A/400). (7) Install the toilet shroud assembly ( AMM TASK 25-40-04-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 38-32-02 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
